body: @rhtyd a Trillian-Jenkins test job (centos7 mgmt + vmware-55u3) has been kicked to run smoke tests
The Travis failure was due to an env issue, I'll merge this on discretion that affected component test has been fixed. The components are added to Travis in 4.9+ branches.
I've not verified this but I'll proceed with merging this based on review/test/feedback from @pdion891 @resmo and @sebgoa .
@blueorangutan package
@resmo now that PR by @pdion891 is merge, can this be closed? Thanks.
@rhtyd a Jenkins job has been kicked to build packages. I'll keep you posted as I make progress.
@blueorangutan package
@rhtyd a Jenkins job has been kicked to build packages. I'll keep you posted as I make progress.
Ping @leprechau @kiwiflyer
Packaging result: ✖centos6 ✔centos7 ✔debian. JID-375

@rhtyd Understood! I have one more PR pending after this which should make IPv6 usable in Basic Networking.

4.11 would be great to get this in.
Packaging result: ✔centos6 ✔centos7 ✔debian. JID-376

So to get this clear, you might OOM hypervisors due to this since you allocate more memory on them?

Or is this just the cluster threshold and it still might not find a suitable hypervisor
@rhtyd Can you plz merge this?
Rebased with 4.9
OOM on HV won't happen, only cluster threshold check is skipped in case of starting a stopped VM
@blueorangutan test
@rhtyd a Trillian-Jenkins test job (centos7 mgmt + kvm-centos7) has been kicked to run smoke tests
@jburwell  I have modified the base branch to 4.9 . Also added a marvin test to check nic details.

@ustcweizhou 
I am updating code for the LB rules as well
Thanks @rhtyd !

Hi @resmo,  I've made some changes on the Docker file so it might not be possible to merge this PR in the current state.

Thanks!
ok, np closing for now

We are running this PR as well as #1706 in production and the merge conflict for merging the two PRs together is quite complicated.  Because we had to do the merge conflict for our production of these two PRs, I decided to add it to this PR so other people who don't have an environment to test against don't have to be responsible for figuring out the merge conflict.

This PR now includes:
- StrongSwan upgrade from OpenSwan.
- Fixes the reversing of public IPs on eth1 when the VR is rebooted.
- #1706 - Cleans up public IPs from the databag when they are removed via ACS. (**Edit:** This has been removed from this PR.  We are using #1907 in production instead, but it is not included in this PR anymore).

The merge conflict between this PR and #1741 is a bit tricky, so I have included this fix in #1741.  @vilisseranen and I are currently running both PRs in production so we had to resolve the merge conflict for our deployment.  Since the resolution is not trivial, I thought it made sense to just include this fix in my PR.
